catalog_info.title: GeoSciFi Movies: Real vs. Fiction
catalog_info.prereq: Course open to Freshman Students Only
catalog_info.description: Natural disasters such as earthquakes, tsunamis, hurricanes, and volcanic eruptions have major impact on society and cause great tragedies.  Dramatization of these phenomena resulted in a number of motion pictures, and while most movies have some scientific foundation in their depiction of the natural events, they inevitably exaggerate or introduce fiction.  Through examination and discussion of real and fictitious effects, this seminar aims to develop appreciation for and interests in the underlying science behind natural phenomena.
